Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class DirectContext

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.core.RefCnt
icyllis.arc3d.engine.Context
icyllis.arc3d.engine.RecordingContext
icyllis.arc3d.engine.DirectContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
RefCounted
public final class DirectContext extends RecordingContext
Represents a backend context of 3D graphics API (OpenGL or Vulkan) on the render thread.

  • Method Details

    • makeOpenGL

      @Nullable public static DirectContext makeOpenGL()
      Creates a DirectContext for a backend context, using default context options.
      Returns:
      context or null if failed to create
      See Also:
      • makeOpenGL(ContextOptions)

    • makeOpenGL

      @Nullable public static DirectContext makeOpenGL(ContextOptions options)
      Creates a DirectContext for a backend context, using specified context options.

      Example with GLFW: 

      
  public static void main(String[] args) {
      System.setProperty("java.awt.headless", Boolean.TRUE.toString());
      if (!glfwInit()) {
          throw new IllegalStateException();
      }
      // default hints use highest OpenGL version and native API
      glfwDefaultWindowHints();
      long window = glfwCreateWindow(1280, 720, "Example Window", NULL, NULL);
      if (window == NULL) {
          throw new IllegalStateException();
      }
      // you can make a thread a render thread
      glfwMakeContextCurrent(window);
      DirectContext direct = DirectContext.makeOpenGL();
      if (direct == null) {
          throw new IllegalStateException();
      }
      ...
      // destroy and close
      direct.discard();
      direct.unref();
      glfwDestroyWindow(window);
      glfwTerminate();
  }
      Returns:
      context or null if failed to create

    • makeVulkan

      @Nullable public static DirectContext makeVulkan(VkBackendContext backendContext)
      Creates a DirectContext for a backend context, using default context options.
      Returns:
      context or null if failed to create
      See Also:
      • makeVulkan(VkBackendContext, ContextOptions)

    • makeVulkan

      @Nullable public static DirectContext makeVulkan(VkBackendContext backendContext, ContextOptions options)
      Creates a DirectContext for a backend context, using specified context options.

      The Vulkan context (VkQueue, VkDevice, VkInstance) must be kept alive until the returned DirectContext is destroyed. This also means that any objects created with this DirectContext (e.g. Surfaces, Images, etc.) must also be released as they may hold refs on the DirectContext. Once all these objects and the DirectContext are released, then it is safe to delete the Vulkan objects.

      Returns:
      context or null if failed to create

    • resetContext

      public void resetContext(int state)
      The context normally assumes that no outsider is setting state within the underlying 3D API's context/device. This call informs the context that the state was modified and it should resend.

      The flag bits, state, is dependent on which backend is used by the context, only GL.

      See Also:
      • Engine.GLBackendState
